Specimen Type: Previously generated WES data files (FASTQ, BAM/CRAM, VCF)
Purpose: To re-evaluate existing WES data with updated databases, tools, and clinical information to detect pathogenic variants that were previously missed or reclassified.
Container: Secure digital storage repository or laboratory information system
Equipment: High-performance computing environment with bioinformatics tools (BWA-MEM, SAMtools, GATK, ANNOVAR, VEP)
